clues.text: This airline is based in Mascot, a suburb of Sydney

Her 1962 rendition of "Happy Birthday" included "Thanks, Mr. Pres., for all the things you've done, the battles that you've won"

In 2022 the TV industry celebrated the 100th birthday of this creative legend & the 50th of his show "Maude"
A birthday fete for Herod Antipas gave his wife Herodias a chance for revenge against this man; his head ended up on a platter
For his 50th, Piet Mondrian's pals in this capital feted him with a retrospective of his works at Stedelijk Museum
This branch of the U.S. Army is its principal land combat force
AAA is this type of artillery used to defend against attack from above
A 3-star general is also known as this type & somewhat surprisingly, outranks a major one
The Army of the Potomac turned back the Army of Northern Virginia at this famously bloody 1862 battle
In the U.S. Army, a WO1 is this type of officer, the army's tactical & technical experts
Describing episodic exploits of a roaming character, the picaresque genre began in the literature of this country of Quixote

In a 1722 work by this author, a woman under the alias Moll Flanders commits various crimes as she climbs a ladder to success

This Latin legal phrase means "from one side only, with the other side absent", not "left the fiesta"
Still existing, like an artwork luckily not lost over the centuries

Before Marvel really started trilogizing, this hero of theirs sunk his teeth into 3 films, the last being 2004's "Trinity"

Title that precedes "How sweet the sound, that saved a wretch like me"

Only subscribers of the Kamashastra Society received the 1st edition of his 10 vol. translation

To strip a priest from his clothes or profession

In sports the "WWF" stands for this, not the World Wildlife Fund
